text: Booked GrabCar outside the temple. Got to know the temples are dedicated to Ma Zhu, Goddess of the Sea and Kuan Shi Yin/ Kuan Zi Zai/Kuan Yin, Goddess of Mercy. Met the old venerable who is burning some joss paper. Unfortunately I couldn’t understand Mandarin. People walking pass the temple will bow and pray towards the statue of Kuan Yin with kids by the side on the right side of the temple. Featuring by the background, the minaret of Al-Iman mosque and the setting of the moon in the morning.

Very nice temple to pray at.

I usually visit the one on the left as they do hold consultations with mazu – though there will be a line. Some just take their number and is not there when called so they skip.
Peaceful,and the volunteers there is very friendly
A nice and cosy Temple that dedicated to Mazu, Goddess of Sea. This is also one of the few Temples that has Mazu's mediumship consultation, which is quite uncommon here.
I went with my mother to pray. It's a very quiet temple on weekends.
